article.headline: Loyola of Chicago 76, N. Iowa 67
article.story: CHICAGO (AP) -- Blake Schilb scored 22 points and grabbed six rebounds Saturday while leading Loyola of Chicago to a 76-67 win over Northern Iowa. The Ramblers used an early 12-0 run, with Schilb contributing seven points, to take a 15-5 lead with 13:55 left in the first half. The Ramblers never trailed the rest of the way. J.R. Blount scored 17 points and Andy Polka added 15 points and seven rebounds for Loyola of Chicago (8-3). After trailing 34-27 at halftime, Northern Iowa cut the deficit to 51-46 on a layup by Grant Stout with 8:08 remaining. Blount responded with a 3-pointer, and the Panthers never got closer than six points down the stretch. Brooks McKowan led Northern Iowa (8-2) with 18 points, and Eric Coleman added 12 points and a game-high 15 rebounds. Northern Iowa outrebounded Loyola of Chicago 38-33 and outscored the Ramblers in the paint 36-32. But the Ramblers enjoyed an advantage at the free throw line, where they went 24-for-33, including Schilb's 11-for-12. Northern Iowa converted 10-of-17 free throws. It was Loyola of Chicago's first win in five meetings against Northern Iowa.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
